place.name: PWLLCROCHON
place.gazetteerText: PWLLCROCHAN, a parish in the district and county of Pembroke; on Milford haven, 4¼ miles W of Pembroke r. station. Post-town, Pembroke. Acres, 3,016; of which 1, 380 are water. Real property, £1, 459. Pop., 364. Houses, 38. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £200.* Patrons, Mrs. Lukin's Trustees. The church was rebuilt in 1342, by R. Beneger, then rector; and contains a monument to him. There is an endowed school, with £12 a year. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
